titleStmt.title: Despatch from Rainilaiairous to Fred G. Frelinghuysen

bibl.title: Despatch from Rainilaiairous to Fred G. Frelinghuysen
Despatches from United States Consuls in Boma, 1888-1895
bibl.publisher: National Archives and Records Service General Services Administration

div1.p: Excellency, Considering the friendly relation, which exists betweeen Madagascar and the U.S. of America, I though it desirable to forward herewith to Your Excellency, Copies of the Correspondence and Reports on the migocialious between our Fleuipoleuliairies and those of the French Government, which took place at Tamatavie; though I refrain myself from making any remarks; thereou, I fed sure that these papers will show you plainly the extreme dsire of the Malagasy Government to revive the friendly relation with the Government of the French Republic.

I leave to your own good judgement to do with these whatever you think proper for the benefit of Madagascar.
I remain, Your Excellency's Sincere Friend (Signed) Rainilaiairous Prime Minister
To, His Excellency, Fred. G. Frelinghuysen Secty of State for the U.S. of America
